w:r.w:t: Thank you for saying yes to continuing your uniquely personal journey as a YPO member. We value your ideas, contributions and commitment to YPO.
Completing your certification should take between 1

minutes depending on any need to recertify, request grace or pay by wire transfer. The first step is to review and update your contact information, followed by completion of your self-certification. The last step is to review and select optional benefits for the year.
Please note, all renewal documents and payments must be submitted before the deadline of 30 June 2017.

YPO members must third party certify every third year until he/she transitions to YPO Gold.
YPO members who will serve on the Board of Directors or on one of the following committees in FY2017-2018: Learning
embers who are currently on grace.
embers reinstating after being absent for more than one year.
Who does not have to third party certify?
YPO Gold members or members transitioning to YPO Gold in FY2017-2018.

YPO members who have qualified for six or more years without grace (new policy as of 1 July 2016). This does not include their application year. If a YPO member has completed six or more years without grace, the member will only be required to self-certify until he/she transitions to YPO Gold.

YPO members who have completed four third party certifications (new policy as of 1 July 2016). This does not include third party certifications for leadership roles and/or requalifying after a period of grace. Members who have completed four third party certifications will only be required to self-certify until he/she transitions to YPO Gold.
Who qualifies as a third party verifier?
An external CPA, independent auditor, chartered accountant or a
ttorney (not an employee of the members qualifying company).

What if my company does not use an external CPA, independent auditor or chartered accountant, or if my company does not prepare an annual report or 10-K filing?
A letter on company letterhead may be submitted along with the completed third party certification form.
The letter must state that the company does
not employ an external CPA, or chartered a
Both the letter and third party certification must be signed by the company’s highest ranking financial officer
